fullDescription.intro: This node identifies duplicate rows. Duplicate rows have identical values in certain columns. The node chooses a single row for each set of duplicates ("chosen"). You can either remove all duplicate rows from the input table and keep only unique rows and chosen rows or mark the rows with additional information about their duplication status.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Allows to select those columns that identify the duplicates. Columns not selected are handled under "Row selection" in the "Advanced" tab.

tab.name: Advanced - Duplicate Rows
tab.option: Removes duplicate rows and keeps only unique and chosen rows.

Appends columns with additional information to the input table:
Add classification column: Appends a column that describes the type of row:
unique: There is no other row with the same values in the selected columns.
chosen: This row was chosen from a set of duplicate rows.
duplicate: This row is a duplicate and represented by another row.
Add ROWID column: Appends a column with the ROWID of the chosen row for duplicate rows. Unique and chosen rows will not have a ROWID assigned.

tab.name: Advanced - Row selection
tab.option:
Defines which row for each set of duplicates is selected:
First:The first row in sequence is chosen.
Last:The last row in sequence is chosen.
Minimum of:The first row with the lowest value in the selected column is chosen. Missing values are sorted after the highest value.
Maximum of:The first row with the largest value in the selected column is chosen. Missing values are sorted before the lowest value.

tab.name: Advanced - Additional options
tab.option: If selected, computation is speed up by utilizing working memory (RAM). The amount of required memory is higher than for a regular computation and also depends on the amount of input data.
If selected, rows in the output table are sorted in the same order as in the input table.

ports.inPort: The data table containing potential duplicates.
ports.outPort: Either the input data without duplicates or the input data with additional columns identifying duplicates.
